abstract.p: Jill and Jim Powerie, British expatriates, operate real estate agency in Montecastelli, Italy, that sells properties in Umbria region (Currents); photo (S)

block.p: Why not call Umbria home? Jill and Jim Powrie moved to Montecastelli from England over 15 years ago and formed a real estate agency specializing in foreign clients. ''We handle everything on site without the purchaser having to speak Italian or tackle the bureaucracy,'' Ms. Powrie said. Their agency covers the region that includes Todi, a picturesque hill town close to Rome popular with foreigners. (Left, a view from the road between Perugia and Todi.) There are 70-odd properties on their books with notable historical or architectural features, some beautifully restored, others requiring complete renovation. A two-bedroom hillside apartment goes for $119,000, and a castle on 50 acres is $1.4 million. Information: 011-39-075-942-6500 or www.greenumbria.com.
